page.title: 02PRESTON'S BENEFACTOR.
page.content: Edmund Robert Harris died in 1877 leaving Â£300,000 for development in Preston. His trust left in 1880 financed The Harris Institute which became an art college and is now part of the Lancashire Polythecnic and the Harris building containing a free library, art gallery and museum,which is situated in Preston town centre. The Harris Orphanage, situated along Garstang Road in Fulwood, has now been bought by the Lancashire Polythecnic to house students. The art gallery was built between 1882 and 1893 in memory of his father, Reverand Robert Harris. Â£40,000 was donated to his institute, dedicated to science and art. It was set up to promote a " diffusion of useful knowledge".
